pages.text: $(item)Save Points$() are a really useful tool when it comes to $(thing)long distance transportation$(). Save Points come in three versions: Normal Save Points, $(#0F0)Linked Save Points$(), and $(#00F)Warp Points$(), where each of them is an upgrade version of the previous one. Normal ones just have two floating green trails, a Linked one has a round plate beneath it, and a Warp Point is the same as a Linked Save Point, but with a blue tint.

Every Save Point serves as a $(thing)respawn point$(), should you have ever lost your soul, similar to how a bed does. For that, the reaction command has to be used that appears once you stand ontop of a Save Point. If it happens to be a Linked or Warp Save Point, then you might also be prompted to give it a name.$(br)$(o)(Note that the current view will serve as the preview image to this save.)$()

If you have more than one Linked or Warp Save Point added, you can $(thing)teleport between them$(). Linked Save POints can teleport to any of your save points within the same dimension, where Warped ones can additionally teleport you to other Warp Points of other Dimensions.$(p)$(lissa)Breaking$() a Save Point will $(lissa)lose all upgrades$().

Additionally, $(thing)Save Points can be upgraded$() with the use of specific $(l:kingdomkeys:synthesize/materials)synthesis materials$(). Each Material increases the recovery rate up to 5 times, where some can only be used on an upgraded version: $(li)Orichalcum: Health $(li)Illusory Crytsal: Magic $(li)$(#0F0)Hungry Crystal$(): Hunger $(li)$(#0F0)Remembrance Crytsal$(): Focus $(li)$(#00F)Evanescent Crystal$(): Drive $(li)Orichalcum Plus: Increases tier $(li2)Normal -> $(#0F0)Linked$() -> $(#00F)Warp$()
